member.summary: Report a notification ONLY if the StatusCode associated with the value changes.

member.summary: Report a notification if either the StatusCode or the value change. The Deadband filter can be used in addition for filtering value changes.
member.remarks: This is the default setting if no filter is set.

member.summary: Report a notification if either StatusCode, value or the SourceTimestamp change. The Deadband filter can be used in addition for filtering value changes.

member.summary: The store containing application instance certificate (or where the application instance certificate will be created).
member.value: For directory certificate store, this is a directory name. For Windows certificate store, this is a "LocalMachine\" followed by a store location.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientEngineParameters.CertificateAcceptancePolicy
member.summary: Determines which server certificates are accepted.

member.summary: Determines the source of the UA configuration.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientEngineParameters.DiscoveryHost
member.summary: The name of the machine that runs the discovery server that will be used for discovery tasks.
member.remarks: Setting this property replaces the with set of standard URLs for all well-known discovery points.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientEngineParameters.DiscoveryUriStrings
member.summary: The URLs of discovery endpoints that will be used for discovery tasks.

remarks.para: A generic string is used instead of , because in some cases, the value may not represent a real URI.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientEngineParameters.DiscoveryTimeout
member.summary: A maximum time a server discovery can take (in milliseconds).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientEngineParameters.RetrialDelay
member.summary: A delay before the component will try to re-initialize itself if a serious failure occurs during startup (in milliseconds).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientEngineParameters.ReconnectionPeriod
member.summary: How often the component checks and processes the list of objects that may need reconnection. In milliseconds.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientEngineParameters.TrustedPeersCertificateStore
member.summary: The store containing any trusted peer certificates.
member.value: For directory certificate store, this is a directory name. For Windows certificate store, this is a "LocalMachine\" followed by a store location.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UASmartEngineParameters.GarbageCollectionPeriod
member.summary: How often the component cleans up unused objects such as sessions and subscriptions. In milliseconds.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UASmartEngineParameters.SessionHoldPeriod
member.summary: After a session object is released, it will be maintained at least for the time period specified here. In milliseconds.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAEngineParameters.AutomaticPublishingFactor
member.summary: Automatic publishing factor that the component uses to determine the publishing interval.
member.remarks: If you do not specify the publishing interval (if it is set to zero in ), the component will calculate it by dividing the sampling interval by this factor, and multiplying by the queue size. The resulting value is limited by .

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAEngineParameters.FastestAutomaticPublishingInterval
member.summary: Fastest publishing interval that the component will use when calculating it.
member.remarks: If the component is determining the publishing interval automatically, it will not make it faster than this value.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClient
member.summary: The EasyUAClient object is the main object that allows simple access to OPC Unified Architecture servers.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClient.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Required for Windows.Forms Class Composition Designer support
member.param: The component container to which the new instance will be added.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClient.Install
member.summary: Creates an application instance certificate if it does not exist.
member.remarks: You can explicitly call this method as part of installation procedure, with administrative rights so that the necessary operations can be performed.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClient.RetryAll
member.summary: Forces a retrial on all objects that are in a failure state.

remarks.para: Individual monitored items, subscriptions, sessions, and the overall controlling engine can be put into a failure when an error occurs while connecting to them, or a serious error renders them unusable later. In such case, the component will automaticaly retry to connect these objects again, after a configurable delay.
This method terminates the waiting delay, and causes all such objects to be retried on next opportunity.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClient.Uninstall
member.summary: Reverts the changes made by method.
member.remarks: The current implemenatation does nothing.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClient.DiscoverServers
member.summary: Discovers available OPC-UA servers and returns information about them.
member.returns: Returns a collection of application elements (servers, ), keyed by their discovery URLs ().

remarks.para: This method uses the so-called Local Discovery Server (LDS). You can influence how the discovery works using the properties in . The name of the machine that runs the discovery is determined by , and defaults to "localhost".
Invokes the FindServers service.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClient.GetMonitoredItemArgumentsDictionary
member.summary: Obtains informatiom about all monitored item subscriptions on this object.
member.returns: Returns a dictionary of monitored item argument objects. The dictionary is keyed by the monitored item subscription handles, and its values contain information describing each subscription.

overloads.summary: Subscribe to changes of a particular monitored item. For each significant monitored item change, either the event is generated, or a specified callback method is invoked.

remarks.para: It is more efficient to subscribe to multiple monitored items using method.

member.summary: Subscribe to a monitored item. Specify an endpoint descriptor, node id, and sampling interval.
member.param: Endpoint descriptor. Identifies the OPC-UA server.
Node Id. Identifies the node in OPC server's address space.
The sampling interval (in milliseconds) indicates the fastest rate at which the Server should sample its underlying source for data changes.
member.returns: The method returns an integer handle that uniquely identifies the monitored item subscription.

remarks.para: You can obtain e.g. from by calling one of the browsing methods on object.

A callback method to be invoked for each significant monitored item change.
member.returns: The method returns an integer handle that uniquely identifies the monitored item subscription.

remarks.para: If is a null reference, only the event is generated, and no callback method is invoked.

member.summary: A default, shared instance of the client object.

remarks.para: Use this property with care, as its usability is limited. Its main use is for testing, and for non-library application code where just a single instance is sufficient.
The default instance is not suitable for Windows Forms or similar environments, where a specific may be used with each form.

We also do not recommend using the default instance for library code, due to conflicts that may arise if your library sets some instance parameters which may not be the same as what other libraries or the final application expects.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds
member.summary: A class that declares constants for Objects in the Model Design.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.DataTypes
member.summary: The node Id for the DataTypes object (folder).
member.remarks:
DataTypes:
"This standard Object is the browse entry point for DataTypes that the Server wishes to expose in the AddressSpace. The standard Object uses Organizes References to reference Objects of the DataTypeSystemType representing DataTypeSystems. Referenced by those Objects are DataTypeDictionaries that refer to their DataTypeDescriptions."

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.EventTypes
member.summary: The node Id for the EventTypes object (folder).
member.remarks:
EventTypes:
"This standard Object Node is the browse entry point for EventType Nodes. "
"Only Organizes References are used to relate Objects and ObjectTypes to the EventTypes standard Object. "
"The intention of the EventTypes Object is that all EventTypes of the Server are either directly or indirectly accessible browsing HierarchicalReferences starting from this Node. It is required that the Server expose all its EventTypes, so a client can usefully subscribe to Events."

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.Objects
member.summary: The node Id for the Objects object (folder).
member.remarks:
Objects:
"This standard Object is the browse entry point for Object Nodes."
"Only Organizes References are used to relate Objects to the Objects standard Object. A View Node can be used as entry point into a subset of the AddressSpace containing Objects and Variables and thus the Objects Object can also reference View Nodes using Organizes References. The intent of the Objects Object is that all Objects and Variables that are not used for type definitions or other organizational purposes (e.g. organizing the Views) are accessible through hierarchical References starting from this Node. However, this is not a requirement, because not all servers may be able to support this. This Object references the standard Server Object."

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.ObjectTypes
member.summary: The node Id for the ObjectTypes object (folder).
member.remarks:
ObjectTypes:
"This standard Object Node is the browse entry point for ObjectType Nodes."
"Only Organizes References are used to relate Objects and ObjectTypes to the ObjectTypes standard Object."
"The intention of the ObjectTypes Object is that all ObjectTypes of the Server are either directly or indirectly accessible browsing HierarchicalReferences starting from this Node. However, this is not required and servers might not provide some of their ObjectTypes because they may be well-known in the industry."
"This Object also indirectly references the BaseEventType defined in 85H6.4.2, which is the base type of all EventTypes. Thereby it is the entry point for all EventTypes provided by the Server. It is required that the Server expose all its EventTypes."

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.OpcBinary
member.summary: The node Id for the OPC Binary object (type system).
member.remarks:
OPC Binary:
"OPC Binary is a standard DataTypeSystem defined by OPC. It is represented in the AddressSpace by an Object Node."
"OPC Binary uses XML to describe complex binary data values.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.ReferenceTypes
member.summary: The node Id for the ReferenceTypes object (folder).
member.remarks:
Reference Types:
"This standard Object is the browse entry point for ReferenceType Nodes."
"Organizes References are used to define ReferenceTypes and Objects referenced by the ReferenceTypes Object. The ReferenceTypes Object shall not reference any other NodeClasses.""

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.Root
member.summary: The node Id for the Root object (folder).
member.remarks:
Root:
"This standard Object is the browse entry point for the AddressSpace. It contains a set of Organizes References that point to the other standard Objects."

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.Server
member.summary: The node Id for the Server object.
member.remarks:
Server Object:
"This Object is used as the browse entry point for information about the Server."
"The Server Object serves as root notifier, i.e. its EventNotifier Attribute shall be set providing Events."

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.Types
member.summary: The node Id for the Types object (folder).
member.remarks:
Types:
"This standard Object Node is the browse entry point for type Nodes."
"Only Organizes References are used to relate Objects to the Types standard Object."

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.VariableTypes
member.summary: The node Id for the VariableTypes object (folder).
member.remarks:
VariableTypes:
"This standard Object is the browse entry point for VariableType Nodes."
"Only Organizes References are used to relate Objects and VariableTypes to the VariableTypes standard Object."
"The intent of the VariableTypes Object is that all VariableTypes of the Server are either directly or indirectly accessible browsing HierarchicalReferences starting from this Node. However, this is not required and servers might not provide some of their VariableTypes, because they may be wellknown in the industry, such as the BaseVariableType.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.Views
member.summary: The node Id for the Views object (folder).
member.remarks:
Views:
"This standard Object is the browse entry point for Views. Only Organizes References are used to relate View Nodes to the Views standard Object. All View Nodes in the AddressSpace shall be referenced by this Node, either directly or indirectly. I.e. the Views Object may reference other Objects using Organizes References. Those Objects may reference additional Views."

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAObjectIds.XmlSchema
member.summary: The node Id for the XML Schema object (type system).
member.remarks:
XML Schema:
"XML Schema is a standard DataTypeSystem defined by the W3C. It is represented in the AddressSpace by an Object Node. XML Schema documents are XML documents whose xmlns attribute in the first line is:
schema xmlns=http://www.w3.org/1999/XMLSchema

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UATreePosition
member.summary: A position in a tree of nodes.

remarks.para: The node that corresponds to the root of the tree is special in that from the properties inherited from , only the Node Id is filled in.

The tree positions can be used to obtain information about the current node, and the nodes on the path to the root, but you cannot access child or sibling nodes of the current node. This is because the tree is constructed "on the fly", as the OPC address space is traversed, and sufficient information about child or sibling nodes may not be available.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientSessionParameters.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: How frequently the server is pinged to see if communication is still working (in milliseconds).
member.value: Frequency in milliseconds, or to disable the keep alive monitoring.
member.remarks: This interval controls (but does not directly mean) how much time elapses before a communication error is detected.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientSessionParameters.RetrialDelay
member.summary: A delay before the component will try to reconnect the session, if it failed to connect it previously, or a serious failure occured related to the session (in milliseconds).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientSessionParameters.SelectBestEndpoint
member.summary: Determines whether the component will automatically attempt to select the best endpoint.

remarks.para: The endpoint is selected using the .
This property should always be 'true' in the current version, because it is not yet possible to specify all endpoint parameters directly.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientSessionParameters.Timeout
member.summary: A session timeout (in milliseconds).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAClientSessionParameters.UpdateEndpointBeforeConnect
member.summary: Determines whether to update the endpoint description with information from the server's discovery endpoint before the session is connected.
member.remarks: This property should always be 'false' in the current version, because the fully qualified endpoints can only come from discovery.

member.summary: Allows to traverse through address space data nodes under the specified node.
member.param: The client object that will perform the operation.
Endpoint descriptor. Identifies the OPC-UA server.
Node Id. Identifies the node in OPC server's address space.
member.returns: Returns an enumerator of tree positions that will traverse through all nodes specified.

remarks.para: Performs a breadth-first traversal.
The root position in a tree will correspond to the specified starting node. The object for the root is special one, in that from its properties, only its NodeId is filled in.
You can obtain e.g. from by calling one of the browsing methods on object.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClientExtension.TraverseNodeTree(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.EasyUAClient,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UAEndpointDescriptor,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UANodeId,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UABrowseParameters)

Endpoint descriptor. Identifies the OPC-UA server.
Node Id. Identifies the node in OPC server's address space.
Browse parameters such as node classes and reference types to be returned.
member.returns: Returns an enumerator of tree positions that will traverse through all nodes specified.

remarks.para: Performs a breadth-first traversal.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UADeadbandType
member.summary: A value that defines the Deadband type and behaviour.
member.remarks:
"Deadband is a permitted range for value changes that will not trigger a data change Notification."
"Deadband can be applied as a filter when subscribing to Variables and is used to keep noisy signals from updating the Client unnecessarily"

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UADeadbandType.None
member.summary: No Deadband calculation should be applied.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UADeadbandType.Absolute
member.summary: Absolute Deadband.
member.remarks:
"
For this type the deadbandValue contains the absolute change in a data value that shall cause a Notification to be generated. This parameter applies only to Variables with any number data type.
An exception that causes a DataChange Notification based on an AbsoluteDeadband is determined as follows:
Exception if (absolute value of (last cached value - current value) > AbsoluteDeadband)
The last cached value is defined as the most recent value previously sent to the Notification channel.
If the item is an array of values, the entire array is returned if any array element exceeds the /// AbsoluteDeadband.
"

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UADeadbandType.Percent
member.summary: Percent Deadband.
member.remarks:
"
For this type of deadband the deadbandValue is defined as the percentage of the EURange. That is, it applies only to AnalogItems with an EURange Property that defines the typical value range for the item. This range shall be multiplied with the deadbandValue to generate an exception limit. An exception is determined as follows:
Exception if (absolute value of (last cached value - current value) > (deadbandValue/100.0) * ((highlow) of EURange)))
If the item is an array of values and any array element exceeds the deadbandValue, the entire monitored array is returned.
"

NodeClasses:

member.summary: The Object node class.
member.remarks:
Object NodeClass:
"Objects are used to represent systems, system components, real-world objects and software objects."

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UANodeClass.Variable
member.summary: The Variable node class.
member.remarks:
Variable NodeClass:
"Variables are used to represent values which may be simple or complex. Variables are defined by VariableTypes [...].
Variables are always defined as Properties or DataVariables of other Nodes in the AddressSpace. They are never defined by themselves. A Variable is always part of at least one other Node, but may be related to any number of other Nodes. Variables are defined using the Variable NodeClass, [...]."

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UANodeClass.Method
member.summary: The Method node class.
member.remarks:
Method NodeClass:
"Methods define callable functions. Methods are invoked using the Call Service [...]. Method invocations are not represented in the AddressSpace. Method invocations always run to completion and always return responses when complete. Methods are defined using the Method NodeClass, [...]."

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UANodeClass.ObjectType
member.summary: The ObjectType node class.
member.remarks:
ObjectType NodeClass:
"ObjectTypes provide definitions for Objects. ObjectTypes are defined using the ObjectType NodeClass [...]."

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UANodeClass.VariableType
member.summary: The VariableType node class.
member.remarks:
VariableType NodeClass:
"VariableTypes are used to provide type definitions for Variables. VariableTypes are defined using the VariableType NodeClass, [...]."

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UANodeClass.ReferenceType
member.summary: The ReferenceType node class.
member.remarks:
ReferenceType NodeClass:
"References are defined as instances of ReferenceType Nodes. ReferenceType Nodes are visible in the AddressSpace and are defined using the ReferenceType NodeClass [...]. In contrast, a Reference is an inherent part of a Node and no NodeClass is used to represent References."

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UANodeClass.DataType
member.summary: The DataType node class.
member.remarks:
DataType NodeClass:
"The DataType NodeClass describes the syntax of a Variable Value. The DataTypes may be simple or complex, depending on the DataTypeSystem. DataTypes are defined using the DataType NodeClass, [...]."

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.UA.UANodeClass.View
member.summary: The View node class.
member.remarks:
View NodeClass:
"Underlying systems are often large and clients often have an interest in only a specific subset of the data. They do not need, or want, to be burdened with viewing Nodes in the AddressSpace for which they have no interest.
To address this problem, [the] specification defines the concept of a View. Each View defines a subset of the Nodes in the AddressSpace. The entire AddressSpace is the default View. Each Node in a View may contain only a subset of its References, as defined by the creator of the View. The View Node acts as the root for the Nodes in the View. Views are defined using the View NodeClass, [...]."

Attribute:
"A primitive characteristic of a Node. All Attributes are defined by OPC UA, and may not be defined by Clients or Servers. Attributes are the only elements in the AddressSpace permitted to have data values."
